The long reign of Libyan dictator Moammar Gadhafi came to a bloody end in October, but only after months of fighting.
Anti-Gadhafi forces on the ground, supported from the air by NATO air strikes on Gadhafi strongholds,...
...brought an end to his four decades of rule.
The campaign to oust him is estimated to have taken the lives of as many as 40,000 Libyans.
